channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: RPI Food Pantry Open July 1st and 2nd
item.description: Date: Tuesday, July 1, 2025 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM - During the Summer break the Food pantry will remain open for the normal summer hours Tuesday 1-4pm and Wednesday 9am - noon
item.author: Students

item.title: Summer 2025 Session II Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Friday, June 13, 2025 (all day) - Summer 2025 Session II student course evaluations are now open. The evaluation period is from 6/13 through 6/27. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Friday, June 27, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Health & Wellness Consultant Cory Wallack: Strategies and Process for Implementing Integrated and Wholistic Health And Wellness Services
item.description: Friday, June 27, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - In this presentation, Dr.¬†Wallack will review approaches for developing integrated health and wellness services. Throughout the presentation, he will review implementation strategies within the traditional health and wellness offices (i.e., counseling, health, health promotion, recreation) as well as broader campus approaches that can create and sustain a wellness promoting culture.
item.author: Community

item.title: Distinguished Bedford Visiting Professor Seminar - Walter Woodington, ir, P.E. | June 30
item.description: Date: Monday, June 30, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - ‚ÄúCreativity as a Common Language‚Äù. Since both professions are required to build, we struggle through the language barrier. Time, experience, and mutual respect eventually allow for communication, with successful buildings being the proof of that. I propose creativity as the common language for architects and engineers. Walter Woodington is a structural engineer with over 10 years of experience in New York City with projects on multiple continents.
item.author: Community

item.title: Human Resources Has a New Home‚ÄîCome Visit Us this Friday for an Open House!
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to invite you to an Open House at our new HR location in the Chasan Building. Stop by to tour our new space, visit and enjoy light refreshments as we celebrate this exciting move. üìç Location: Chasan Building, 405 Broadway, 1st Floor, Troy, NY 12180 üìÖDate: Friday, June 27, 2025 ‚è∞Time: 11:00 a.m. ‚Äì 1:00 p.m. Visitor parking will be available at Blitman Residence Commons or on-street parking along Broadway and 4th Street.
item.author: Community

item.title: Reminder for the Campus Card Office
item.description:
If your department has any Guest, Contractor, or Vendor cards expiring on or before July 1, 2025, please renew them by June 30 to avoid any access disruptions. Visit the Campus Card Office webpage and fill out an Access Request Form to renew any cards. Questions? We‚Äôre happy to help! Contact us at campuscard@rpi.edu. Thanks for your attention and cooperation!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
